main_definition: Individuals or entities that act as intermediaries in transactions, typically buying and selling goods, services, or financial instruments on behalf of others.

meanings_and_examples.example: A stockbroker facilitates the sale and purchase of shares between investors.
An insurance broker helps clients find appropriate insurance coverage by comparing different policies from various providers.
A real estate agent assists buyers and sellers in property transactions, helping to negotiate prices and contracts.
A commodity trader buys or sells agricultural products like wheat, corn, or soybeans on behalf of their clients.
An export/import broker specializes in dealing with the import and export of goods between countries.
